alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Jackson; Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 1:56AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Marshall, south central Jackson and DeKalb Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 155 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Albertville, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albertville, Scottsboro, Fort Payne, Boaz, Guntersville, Rainsville, Henagar, Crossville, Sylvania and Fyffe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
